articles.description: Owen Farrell will make his first start of the tour in the British and Irish Lions' final midweek game against a First Nations and Pasifika XV on Tuesday.
articles.title: British and Irish Lions: Owen Farrell to captain against First Nations & Pasifika XV

articles.description: With a vice-like grip on the game, Scottie Scheffler's Open victory shows how he has become the most dominant men's golfer since Tiger Woods.
articles.title: The Open 2025: How Scottie Scheffler has become the world's most dominant golfer since Tiger Woods

articles.description: England defender Lucy Bronze says players are getting more abuse the bigger women's football becomes.
articles.title: Abuse growing in women's football, says England's Lucy Bronze

articles.description: British number one Jack Draper withdraws from the forthcoming Canadian Open and Cincinnati Open with an arm injury, but targets a return at the US Open.
articles.title: Jack Draper: Briton targets US Open return after arm injury

articles.description: Scottie Scheffler says he is "living out his dreams" after winning the Open Championship, but reiterated there is "more to life than playing golf".
articles.title: The Open 2025: Scottie Scheffler 'living dreams' but reiterates 'more to life than golf'

articles.description: Belgian road champion Tim Wellens claims his first Tour de France stage victory with a breakaway win on stage 15.
articles.title: Tour de France 2025 results: Tim Wellens cruises to maiden Tour win on stage 15

articles.description: World champion Luke Littler eases into the last 16 of the World Matchplay with a comfortable 10-2 win over Ryan Searle.
articles.title: World Matchplay: Luke Littler eases into last 16 after beating Ryan Searle

articles.description: BBC Sport looks at where Oleksandr Usyk ranks among the all-time heavyweight greats and who in the current generation could beat him.
articles.title: Usyk vs Dubois 2: Oleksandr Usyk & 'Ivan' - the untouchable duo who can't be beaten?

articles.description: The Lions finished the first Test sloppily but at their best they're streets ahead of the Wallabies, writes Tom English.
articles.title: British and Irish Lions 2025: 'Desperation driving Australia - but it only gets you so far'

articles.description: Arsenal defender Gabriel Magalhaes says "things will be different" this season after missing out on the Premier League title again.
articles.title: 'Things will be different' - Gabriel on Arsenal title hopes
